quote: Fear keeps us focused on the past or worried about the future. If we can acknowledge our fear, we can realize that right now we are okay. Right now, today, we are still alive, and our bodies are working marvelously. Our eyes can still see the beautiful sky. Our ears can still hear the voices of our loved ones.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: If you know the enemy and know yourself you need not fear the results of a hundred battles.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

quote: I tremble for my country when I reflect that God is just; that his justice cannot sleep forever.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. The fearful are caught as often as the bold.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I think fearless is having fears but jumping anyway.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
author: Buddha

quote: Always do what you are afraid to do.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There is no such thing as paranoia. Your worst fears can come true at any moment.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: I may be compelled to face danger, but never fear it, and while our soldiers can stand and fight, I can stand and feed and nurse them.
author: Clara Barton

quote: Ultimately we know deeply that the other side of every fear is freedom.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear; knowing what must be done does away with fear.
author: Rosa Parks

quote: Humble souls are fearful of their own strength.
author: William Gurnall

quote: Thinking will not overcome fear but action will.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: What is a fear of living? It's being preeminently afraid of dying. It is not doing what you came here to do, out of timidity and spinelessness. The antidote is to take full responsibility for yourself - for the time you take up and the space you occupy. If you don't know what you're here to do, then just do some good.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I love the man that can smile in trouble, that can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but he whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves his conduct, will pursue his principles unto death.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Don't be afraid to see what you see.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his great surprises, is to find he can do what he was afraid he couldn't do.
author: Henry Ford

quote: We simply attempt to be fearful when others are greedy and to be greedy only when others are fearful.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Fear is the mother of foresight.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Great work is done by people who are not afraid to be great.
author: Fernando Flores

quote: Only when we are no longer afraid do we begin to live.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.
author: Chanakya

quote: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: We fear things in proportion to our ignorance of them.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: Never be afraid to sit a while and think.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: The first duty of man is to conquer fear; he must get rid of it, he cannot act till then.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: I say I am stronger than fear.
author: Malala Yousafzai

quote: Fear is excitement without breath.
author: Robert Heller

quote: We should not be afraid to go into a new era, to leave the old beyond.
author: Zach Wamp

quote: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Do what you fear and fear disappears.
author: David Joseph Schwartz

quote: Fear has many eyes and can see things underground.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Show me a guy who's afraid to look bad, and I'll show you a guy you can beat every time.
author: Lou Brock

quote: True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.
author: Paul Sweeney

quote: Fear can be good when you're walking past an alley at night or when you need to check the locks on your doors before you go to bed, but it's not good when you have a goal and you're fearful of obstacles. We often get trapped by our fears, but anyone who has had success has failed before.
author: Queen Latifah

quote: There are times when fear is good. It must keep its watchful place at the heart's controls.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Nothing gives a fearful man more courage than another's fear.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: I have never known any distress that an hour's reading did not relieve.
author: Montesquieu

quote: There is no hope unmingled with fear, and no fear unmingled with hope.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: I hasten to laugh at everything, for fear of being obliged to weep.
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quote: We fear the thing we want the most.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: To pity distress is but human; to relieve it is Godlike.
author: Horace Mann

quote: We consume our tomorrows fretting about our yesterdays.
author: Persius

quote: No good work is ever done while the heart is hot and anxious and fretted.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: You are only afraid if you are not in harmony with yourself. People are afraid because they have never owned up to themselves.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: True nobility is exempt from fear.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Hate is the consequence of fear; we fear something before we hate it; a child who fears noises becomes a man who hates noise.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: To him who is in fear everything rustles.
author: Sophocles

quote: There are very few monsters who warrant the fear we have of them.
author: Andre Gide

quote: So then learn to conquer your fear. This is the only art we have to master nowadays: to look at things without fear, and to fearlessly do right.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: One had to take some action against fear when once it laid hold of one.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: There are things which a man is afraid to tell even to himself, and every decent man has a number of such things stored away in his mind.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: He will never have true friends who is afraid of making enemies.
author: William Hazlitt
